channel.title: Plans on Brian Schuth
channel.description: Recent content in Plans on Brian Schuth

item.title: Books to Read
item.description: Oh, my god. This is my biggest problem, the huge list of books that look interesting to me that I want to read. New Books Titles I’ve come across that make me want to read them: The Battle of the Classics, Eric Adler, OUP. Saw this in an email from Oxford; as a programmer with a philosophy degree, the father of two English majors, a music major, and the husband of a violin performance major, and a guy who is trying to read ancient Greek in his spare time, justification of education in the humanities is something I care a lot about.

item.title: Future Classes
item.description: If I were to create more “classes” of my own devising, here’s my list of what I want to address: Learning Clojure (with SICP as a secondary text) Greek Tragedy (focus on reading Greek, but with practical additions. One tragedy at a time.) Software Architecture Lit Review (how to consolidate all those books and all that I’ve read over all this time?) German for Bach Cantatas (supports the yearly listening, simple way to absorb a sub-vocabulary of German)
